related_post.text: > i was going to post this ||https://stackoverflow.com/questions/582056/gettinglistofparameternamesinsidepythonfunction||@Notepad hey this reminds me is there a way to get args in a function but in the dictionary format like kwargs. Normally when we make a dictionary we have to do `dict(a=a,b=b)` but if key name is same as the variable name it'd be easier to do just `mydict(a,b)` which will give dict `{'a':a,'b':b}`. is it possible?

so_post.text: > i was going to post this ||https://stackoverflow.com/questions/582056/gettinglistofparameternamesinsidepythonfunction||@Notepad hey this reminds me is there a way to get args in a function but in the dictionary format like kwargs. Normally when we make a dictionary we have to do `dict(a=a,b=b)` but if key name is same as the variable name it'd be easier to do just `mydict(a,b)` which will give dict `{'a':a,'b':b}`. is it possible?
